solution_line_template: First find the total number of ducklings the first two ducks have: {num_ducks_group1} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck_group1} ducklings/duck = <<{num_ducks_group1}*{ducklings_per_duck_group1}={ducklings_group1}>>{ducklings_group1} ducklings

Then find the total number of ducklings the next six ducks have: {num_ducks_group2} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck_group2} ducklings/duck = <<{num_ducks_group2}*{ducklings_per_duck_group2}={ducklings_group2}>>{ducklings_group2} ducklings

Then find the total number of ducklings the last 9 ducks have: {num_ducks_group3} ducks * {ducklings_per_duck_group3} ducklings/duck = <<{num_ducks_group3}*{ducklings_per_duck_group3}={ducklings_group3}>>{ducklings_group3} ducklings

Then add up all the ducks and ducklings to find the total number: {ducklings_group1} ducklings + {ducklings_group2} ducklings + {ducklings_group3} ducklings + {num_ducks_group1} ducks + {num_ducks_group2} ducks + {num_ducks_group3} ducks = <<{ducklings_group1}+{ducklings_group2}+{ducklings_group3}+{num_ducks_group1}+{num_ducks_group2}+{num_ducks_group3}={total_ducks_and_ducklings}>>{total_ducks_and_ducklings} ducks
